title: In which city is Britain's oldest museum? - Quora

response.answer_text: From Wikipedia:- The Ashmolean Museum of Art and Archaeology (/æʃˈmoʊliən, ˌæʃməˈliːən/) on Beaumont Street, Oxford, England, is the world's first university museum and Britain's first public museum. Its first building was erected in 1678–1683 to house the cabinet of curiosities that Elias Ashmole gave to the University of Oxford in 1677. Ashmolean Museum  The museum's main entrance  Location in Oxford Established 1683; 337 years ago Location Beaumont Street, Oxford, England Coordinates 51.7554°N 1.2600°W Type University Museum of Art and Archaeology Visitors 930,669 (2019) Director Alexander Sturgis Website www.ashmolean.org The present building was erected 1841–1845. The museum reopened in 2009 after a major redevelopment. In November 2011, new galleries focusing on Egypt and Nubia were unveiled. In May 2016, the museum opened new galleries of 19th-century art.
Oxford’s Ashmolean is credited as the first but you might consider the Roman remains in Bath, London, Chester or York which are curated within modern complexes to be older in some sense.
